1.name: Hide (forest)
1.text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

2.name: Encourage
2.text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

3.name: Immune to Psychology
3.text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

4.name: Shielded
4.text: Shields have a chance of blocking arrows, bolts, rifle shots and similar small arms fire - but only in a forward facing arc.

5.name: Armoured
5.text: Armoured units can block damage from any source apart from Armour-Piercing damage.

6.name: Armoured & Shielded
6.text: Armoured units can block damage from any source apart from Shields have a chance of blocking arrows, bolts, rifle shots and similar small arms fire - but only in a forward facing arc.

7.name: Armour-Piercing
7.text: The damage of armour-piercing weapons mostly ignores the armour of the target, making them the ideal choice against heavily-armoured enemies. They are often heavier and attack at a slower rate though, making them less efficient against poorly-armoured targets.

8.name: Armour-Piercing Missiles
8.text: The damage of armour-piercing weapons mostly ignores the armour of the target, making them the ideal choice against heavily-armoured enemies. They are often heavier and attack at a slower rate though, making them less efficient against poorly-armoured targets.

9.name: Duellist
9.text: This unit is best used to attack individual targets such as Heroes. As it can only damage very few individuals at a time, it is not suitable against hordes of weak enemies.

11.name: Causes Fear
11.text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

12.name: Causes Terror
12.text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

13.name: Very Fast
13.text: This unit can run circles around most other units, taunting and harrassing the enemy or evading its missile fire.

14.name: Battle Prayers
14.text: This unit can learn prayers to support allies and defeat foes in battle.

15.name: Unbreakable
15.text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

16.name: Frenzy
16.text: Units with frenzy cause more damage while their leadership is high.

17.name: Damage Dealer
17.text: This unit has a strong emphasis on dealing damage. If fighting it, make sure to take it out before it can get into firing or melee range.

18.name: Anti-Infantry
18.text: Anti-infantry units have an advantage against targets that are smaller than a horse. This advantage can be a damage bonus against small targets, superior weight used to smash through lighter enemies, or an explosive attack from range that effects a large area.

19.name: Anti-Large
19.text: Anti-large units have an advantage against targets that are at least as large as a horse. This advantage acn be a damage bonus against large targets or an attack that focuses on a very small area. However, some units are simply better against large targets because their attacks are slow and easy to dodge by skilled melee combatants.

20.name: Decent Melee Combatant
20.text: Despite being primarily a missile unit or spellcaster, this unit can also hold its own ground when fighting in melee.

21.name: Weak Against Armour
21.text: This unit's attack can hardly punch through armour and is thus wasted on heavily armoured enemies.

22.name: Vanguard Deployment
22.text: This unit can deploy in an expanded deployment area, allowing it to start the battle within striking distance of the enemy - or somewhere unexpected.

23.name: Good Range
23.text: This unit has a larger range than most other units of the same class. This allows it to take out hostile missile units before they can come into firing range.

24.name: Charge Defence vs. Large
24.text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.

25.name: Fire Whilst Moving
25.text: This unit can fire while on the move.

26.name: Can't Attack Air
26.text: Some ranged weapons, like grenade launchers, bombs or blasting charges, can't target airborne units.

27.name: Low Rate of Fire
27.text: This unit has a very low rate of missile fire.

28.name: Solheim's Bolt of Illumination
28.text: The Luminark fires a highly-accurate beam over large distances, causing tremendous damage to its target but with a small area of effect, making it a poor choice against weak infantry.

29.name: Magical Aura
29.text: This unit is surrounded by one or more magical auras that either support nearby friends or harm its foes.

30.name: Cannot Run
30.text: This unit cannot run and will only move at walking pace.

31.name: Poor Accuracy
31.text: This unit's attacks are prone to go stray.

32.name: Missile Resistance
32.text: ** || Damage of missile attacks is reduced by this amount.

33.name: Siege Attacker
33.text: This unit can attack city gates, allowing you to instantly launch a siege battle without having to wait for towers or battering rams to be built.

34.name: Magic Resistance
34.text: ** || Damage of magical attacks is reduced by this amount.

35.name: Melee Expert
35.text: Melee Experts might have a very strong melee attack or melee defence, or high values in both. Some also have melee-focused skills like Charge Defence. Use them to counter other strong melee units. When facing them, it is best to take them out before they can enter melee.

36.name: Stalk
36.text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

37.name: Magical Attacks
37.text: ** || This unit inflicts magical attacks which can harm units that are protected from regular physical attacks.

38.name: Flaming Attacks
38.text: ** || This unit inflicts flaming attacks which can do additional damage against units that are vulnerable to fire.

39.name: Physical Resistance
39.text: ** || Damage of non-magical attacks is reduced by this amount.

40.name: Noxious Breath
40.text: Some Dragons breathe noxious fumes that have a long-lasting effect on their target's coordination - if it survived the attack in the first place.

41.name: Good Against Gates
41.text: Doors and gates all across the world fear the Khainite Assassin's assortment of lock picks and acid vials.

42.name: Poison Attacks
42.text: ** || The poisonous attacks of this unit weaken the target's speed and damage, whilst reducing its vigour.

43.name: Sea Dragon Cloak
43.text: The scaled leather of the flightless Sea Dragon provides a very light yet incredibly sturdy material for armour.

44.name: Madness of Khaine! (15 seconds)
44.text: ** || The Witch Elves' venom makes its target susceptible to the Madness of Khaine - forcing it into a mindless, rampaging bloodlust.

45.name: Murderous Mastery
45.text: Merciless, frenzied agents of slaughter even when unprovoked, this unit takes especially well to Khaine's murderous blessing.

46.name: Dodge
46.text: This highly dexterous unit dodges blades and missiles with ease; its luck is known to run out quickly when facing magical weapons, however.

47.name: Primal Instincts
47.text: When under pressure, the primal instincts of these natural predators take over. They then may go on a rampage against nearby enemy units, attacking the closest one and ignoring any orders given.

48.name: Multi-Shot Ammunition
48.text: This unit can switch its ammunition to fire multiple smaller shots instead of one large one. This is not as accurate or effective against large targets, but the spread of missiles can be helpful against hordes.

49.name: Fiery Breath
49.text: Just give the order and the Hydra's heads will spew forth their fiery breath, each competing for the brightest flame.

50.name: Scaly Skin
50.text: Scaly skin or hides help to dampen or deflect the damage caused by missile weapons, increasing this unit's Missile Resistance.

51.name: Regeneration
51.text: Regeneration allows a unit to heal while in battle. Fire is known to harm this healing process, so be warned that flaming attacks will cause more damage to units with Regeneration.

52.name: Undead
52.text: This unit is Undead (does not rout, immune to terror, becomes unstable when Leadership is low). It will suffer from attrition when moving through territory not owned by the Undead.

53.name: Ethereal
53.text: Ethereal units ignore most damage done by non-magical weapons. As they have shed most of their physical form, they are not slowed by terrain-based movement penalties either.

54.name: Meat Shield
54.text: While unimpressive at causing damage, this unit is useful as a 'meat shield', absorbing damage that would otherwise hurt a more useful or precious target.

55.name: Magic Disruption
55.text: Increases the chance of enemy Wizards miscasting in close vicinity to a Corpse Cart.

56.name: Mass Regeneration
56.text: Regenerates nearby friendly units' hit points.

57.name: Evocation of Death
57.text: The Black Coach feeds on magical energy that bolsters its resistance and strengthens its charge.

58.name: Magic Harvester
58.text: Increases the level of magic power reserves.

59.name: Poor Leadership
59.text: This unit suffers from poor leadership and will easily rout. Keep its flanks secure and your Lord or other encouraging units nearby.

60.name: Forest Spirit
60.text: The spirits of Athel Loren are able to shrug off most mundane attacks, causing magical damage in turn before melting into the forest from whence they came.

61.name: Fire Weakness
61.text: ** || Damage of flaming attacks is increased by this amount.

62.name: Forest Stalker
62.text: The Elves of Athel Loren gain bonuses to melee defence and accuracy while fighting within the forest.

63.name: Master Ambusher
63.text: This unit can move whilst hidden in any terrain, firing in any direction even whilst running!

64.name: Snipe
64.text: This unit remains hidden while firing.

65.name: Shadow Dances of Loec
65.text: The servants and worshippers of Loec perform many intricate, swirling, lethal dances in his name.

66.name: Swift Shiver Shards
66.text: As their enchanted arrows are both light and strong this unit can fire two at a time, but at a cost of range.

67.name: No Forest Penalty
67.text: Large units do not suffer penalties when moving through forest, simply smashing through the undergrowth instead.

68.name: Aura of Transmutation
68.text: Morghur's Ruinous, transformative aura protects him from damage most of the time, but he is vulnerable whilst it recharges.

69.name: Expendable
69.text: Witnessing friendly expendable units rout does not reduce other units' Leadership, unless they are themselves expendable.

70.name: Rampage
70.text: When this unit gets hurt and enemies are nearby it might go on a rampage, attacking the closest enemy and ignoring any orders given.

71.name: Special Ranged Weapon
71.text: This unit has a special missile attack with limited ammunition, which can be very useful when initiating attacks.

72.name: Living Saints
72.text: Knights who have sipped from the Grail are elevated above mere mortals; they truly are what is best in men.

73.name: Perfect Vigour
73.text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

74.name: Expert Charge Defence
74.text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

75.name: Runic Magic
75.text: This unit can bind magic into powerful runes which can be activated during battle.

76.name: Ballistics Expert
76.text: This unit improves all nearby friendly missile units.

77.name: Old Grumblers
77.text: Respected for their great age, superior courage and the length of their facial hair, Longbeards have an encouraging effect on their allies leadership should the Lord be absent.

78.name: Fast (for a Dwarf)
78.text: While Dwarfs are generally not the most nimble inhabitants of the Old World, they can move surprisingly fast when not slowed by heavy armour.

79.name: Deathblow
79.text: Slayers are unbreakable and always fight to the bitter end - sometimes even beyond that! Imminent death only makes them fight harder. When killed in melee, Slayers launch a final attack with their dying breaths.

80.name: Whirling Axes
80.text: Slayers are armed with two axes, deftly whirling them at high speed to deflect incoming missile fire.

81.name: Armour-Sundering
81.text: ** || The armour-splitting attacks of this unit can significantly weaken the target's armour.

82.name: Fire Resistance
82.text: ** || Damage of flaming attacks is reduced by this amount.

84.name: Death from Above
84.text: While airborne, this unit can use a special attack to damage enemies below.

85.name: Improved Bombing
85.text: Like a rain of mighty hammer-blows from above, this unit drops more than one bomb at the same time.

86.name: Goblin Mangonel
86.text: A particularly stupid and otherwise useless Goblin prisoner is tied to a boulder and is then fired - screaming all the way - until he smashed into the target. Those hit by this projectile receive a leadership penalty.

88.name: Strider
88.text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

89.name: Warpaint
89.text: The colourful tattoos on their bare skin grant Savage Orcs Physical Resistance, which reduces the damage from any non-magical attack.

90.name: Bigger & 'Arder
90.text: The heaviest, strongest and meanest of Orcs, Big 'Uns are eager to prove it against enemies of all sizes.

91.name: Armed to da Teef
91.text: Wielding an 'eavy choppa in each hand, the Krimson Killerz cleave through several foes with each swing.

92.name: Guided Projectile
92.text: The projectile fired by this unit can home in on its target. When fired in first-person mode, you can control the projectile yourself.

93.name: Da Great Green Wallop
93.text: As if smote by mighty Gork himself, this unit's projectile blinds its target on impact, reducing accuracy, melee attack and melee defence capabilities.

95.name: Moon Dragon's Breath
95.text: After a Moon Dragon's fiery breath engulfs its victim, scorched armour is often all that remains.

96.name: Star Dragon's Breath
96.text: The eldest, most powerful Dragons can melt armour and the flesh beneath with a molten blast of their white-hot breath.

97.name: Sun Dragon's Breath
97.text: The Sun Dragon's scorching breath lacks focus, but hitting a larger area is actually an advantage when fighting infantry groups.

98.name: Lion Cloak
98.text: White Lion fur is not merely a fashionable status symbol, it also provides protection against regular and magical missile attacks.

99.name: Forest Strider
99.text: Specialists in forest warfare, this unit gains melee attack and defence advantages when fighting in forests.

100.name: Deflect Shots
100.text: The art of deflecting arrows with a greatsword is painful to learn; such training is discouraged by Bladelord officers, but no true Swordmaster will let caution best his pride.

101.name: Reaver Bows
101.text: These enchanted bows, only entrusted to those of noble birth, fire three arrows at once.

102.name: Dragon Armour
102.text: Fire attacks cannot harm the wearer of this enchanted, volcano-forged armour.

103.name: Martial Mastery
103.text: A rigorous selection process and relentless training have turned this unit into the perfect fighting machine. This effect is lost, however, if the unit is badly damaged.

104.name: Rebirth
104.text: When death is imminent, this unit has a chance of regaining some of its health.

105.name: Attuned to Magic
105.text: This unit has magical attacks and becomes stronger when the winds of magic are in full gale.

106.name: Predatory Senses
106.text: These units are natural hunters that can sense prey hiding nearby.

107.name: Aquatic
107.text: Where other units of small stature struggle to fight and move in shallow water, Aquatic units excel.

108.name: Chameleon
108.text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain and is exceptionally hard to target with missile attacks.

109.name: Revivification Crystal
109.text: The crystal protects those who worship the Serpent God, healing wounds and bringing supplicants back from the point of death.

110.name: Beam of Chotec
110.text: An intense, white-hot shaft of light emanates forth, burning and blinding the foe with the wrath of Chotec himself.

111.name: Plague Censer
111.text: Warpstone dust and vile contagions fill this diabolical censer, exposure to which does horrendous things to bodies and minds alike.

113.name: Weeping Blades
113.text: Weeping Blades devour armour. A couple of slashes is all that's needed for their corrosive venom to eat through even the thickest of plates.

114.name: Concealment Bombs
114.text: When a bomb is smashed, a dark smoke curls out, concealing those who wish to hide and choking everyone else.

116.name: Warpfire
116.text: After being showered in an unholy flood of odiferous flames, those left fleeing in panic are the lucky ones.

117.name: Poison Wind Globes
117.text: Misleadingly, and to the horror of anyone exposed to its content, the globes thrown by the Poison Wind Globadiers do not release poison, but a small cloud of lethal Warpstone gas. The larger the target's surface, the more pain it will experience.

118.name: Snare Net
118.text: Short-range throwing attack that slows the target.

119.name: Death Globes
119.text: Invented by Clan Skryre, these globes release a magical gas that is more stable than the Warpstone gas used in Poison Wind Globes. Hanging in the air longer and thus spreading further, it is especially lethal against large groups of targets.

120.name: Too Horrible to Die
120.text: When death is imminent, this unit has a chance of either regaining some of its health or releasing a pack of ravening Skaven instead.

121.name: Plagueclaw Contagion
121.text: Warpstone dust and vile contagions are amongst the ingredients of this catapult's liquid missiles, exposure to which does horrendous things to bodies and minds alike.

122.name: Zzzzap!
122.text: The Doomwheel sports fully automatic Warp-lightning rods which discharge bolts in front, and to the left and right.

123.name: Doomfire
123.text: The Hellcannon transforms the souls of former victims into crackling bolts of energy. Targets hit by this projectile receive a leadership penalty. The daemonic bond between the Hellcannon and its shot also allows minor corrections of the latter's flightpath. When fired in first-person mode, you can control the projectile yourself.

125.name: Light of Death
125.text: The Keeper of the Casket may allow some of the tormented spirits trapped inside to escape; not for mercy, but to let the damned souls rain down upon a loosely-specified area.

126.name: Construct
126.text: This unit is an animated construct (does not rout, is immune to terror, becomes unstable when Leadership is low). Necrotects can push it to its full combat potential and restore it in battle.

128.name: Shieldbreaker
128.text: This unit's shield-breaking attacks can significantly weaken the target's chance of blocking missile attacks.

130.name: Defender
130.text: This elite unit excels at pinning the enemy down in melee, buying time for the rest of your army to get into position.

131.name: Frost Breath
131.text: This icy blast freezes and slows the foe, its withering cold hampering their attacks.

132.name: Frostbite
132.text: The intense cold cuts into the flesh and burns the foe's extremities, greatly reducing their speed.

135.name: Bows of Avelorn
135.text: Loosing arrows of mystical blue fire, they excel at setting vulnerable units ablaze and piercing the toughest armour.

136.name: Mark of Asuryan
136.text: Those who bear the Creator's mark are afforded his divine vengeance; when struck down, their unworthy killer is soon engulfed by Asuryan's vengeful flames!

138.name: Enthralling Attacks
138.text: This unit's melee attacks can stay the hand of those on the receiving end.

140.name: Cursed Ammunition
140.text: Imbued with the foulest proclamations of hate, these ethereal projectiles can tear through entire enemy columns.

142.name: Torch of Bogenhafen
142.text: Instead of salvoes of cannonballs, the infamous 'Gallows Giant' covers its enemies in a wave of incinerating fire.
